image.altText: An older couple, smiling, sitting on a couch, with arms around one another.

props.synopsis: Specialised accommodation will be built in Curtin to house those living with the nation's deadliest disease.

title.children: Canberra will get its first dementia care village on a sold-off school site

image.altText: A lawyer in a suit talking to media.

props.synopsis: Survivors and lawyers welcome the nation-leading legislation, with legal action against churches, sporting groups and others to be affected.

title.children: ACT closes 'legal loophole' making institutions more liable for child sexual abuse

image.altText: An old photo of a young boy in school uniform.

props.synopsis: Survivors watched on as the ACT took a historic step on Tuesday in passing a bill to overturn a High Court decision that allowed a church to avoid litigation over the actions of one of its priests.

title.children: ACT steps up on holding institutions liable for abusers. Why not NSW?

image.altText: A bus and a politician

props.synopsis: Investigators and users say the ACT government's MyWay+ project was rushed and flawed.

title.children: Minister censured over 'user-hateful' public transport upgrades

image.altText: Man in suit and sunglasses beside a woman in a suit jacket and pink shirt wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: A woman who used credit cards from the childcare centre where she worked to purchase personal clothes and cosmetics has been sentenced to jail.

title.children: Woman jailed for $300,000 childcare centre fraud

image.altText: A Virgin plan on the tarmac.

props.synopsis: A man who drove through the airport's perimeter fence three times in 2023 has been sentenced in the ACT Supreme Court.

title.children: Man jailed over theft of Virgin van driven on Canberra Airport tarmac

image.altText: ACT Liberals leader Leanne Castley

props.synopsis: When approached by the ABC this morning, Canberra Liberals leader Leanne Castley would not provide an explanation for why two backbenchers were removed from the party room but insisted they were allowed to cross the floor.

title.children: Castley refuses to explain why backbenchers removed from party room

image.altText: An exterior of a Canberra school.

props.synopsis: The man is warned that he came close to being remanded in custody, with the magistrate saying he is on a "knife-edge".

title.children: Canberra father allegedly threatens daughter and friends with axe outside school

image.altText: A red children's truck sits in front of some other toys on a floor.

props.synopsis: A Four Corners investigation reveals there are more childcare workers convicted or accused of sexual assault than the public has previously understood, including in the ACT.

title.children: Parents not told daughter's childcare teacher was a sex offender

image.altText: A woman wearing a hijab resting on a carpet in an outdoors makeshift camp.

props.synopsis: The UN and others are condemning paramilitary Rapid Support Forces, which reportedly attacked civilians as it moved to seize new territory in the North African country.

title.children: US politicians call for Trump to act on 'unspeakable atrocities' in Sudan

image.altText: Donald Trump and Xi Jinping talk as they stand together.

props.synopsis: The settling of tariffs, a lengthy discussion on the war in Ukraine, and effusive praise for the Chinese leader — here are the main takeaways from the meeting between Donald Trump and Xi Jinping.

title.children: 'An amazing meeting': What you may have missed from the Xi-Trump sit-down

image.altText: Police and people stand near the pyramid of the Louvre museum after the robbery.

props.synopsis: French police have arrested five new people, including a main suspect, over this month's daring jewellery theft from the Louvre museum, the Paris prosecutor says.

title.children: Five new suspects arrested over Louvre heist, Paris prosecutor says

image.altText: A green cricket helmet sits on a fence at a cricket oval.

props.synopsis: Following the death of 17-year-old Ben Austin, experts, including the former doctor for the Australian cricket team, say more focus needs to be put on neck protection at all levels of the sport.

title.children: Tragic death of teen struck by ball turns spotlight on cricket safety

image.altText: Packets of Tim Tams and Penguins on a table.

props.synopsis: Food manufacturers are responding to high cocoa prices, and a change to the UK's Penguin biscuit may have all but cemented Australia's Tim Tam as the better of the two.

title.children: No plans to change Tim Tams after UK rival can no longer be called chocolate

image.altText: An old photo of a young boy in school uniform.

props.synopsis: Survivors watched on as the ACT took a historic step on Tuesday in passing a bill to overturn a High Court decision that allowed a church to avoid litigation over the actions of one of its priests.

title.children: ACT steps up on holding institutions liable for abusers. Why not NSW?

image.altText: A life-size bust of Julius Caesar.

props.synopsis: It is time to see if you have been paying attention — test your memory of this week's news cycle here.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: History exams, an unusual gift and the 'storm of the century'

image.altText: Paleoart showing a pack of Nanotyrannus brazenly attacks a juvenile T. rex.

props.synopsis: A new analysis of a controversial tyrannosaur fossil reveals the dinosaur wasn't a teenage version of T. rex as once thought, but instead a distinct miniature dinosaur.

title.children: Bloody Mary fossil 'flips decades of T. rex research on its head'

image.altText: Two India cricketers in helmets, pads and gloves hug in the middle of the field

props.synopsis: Australia's Women's Cricket World Cup dream is over, ended by India and the greatest run chase in tournament history in a gripping semifinal. Follow live.

title.children: Australia out of World Cup as India completes miracle run chase

image.altText: the James Hardie Industries (JH) logo is seen displayed on a smartphone screen

props.synopsis: James Hardie has a long history of attempting to avoid its responsibilities. The drama began when the company announced a $14 billion purchase of a rival firm.

title.children: 'Blood on the floor': How James Hardie's board came undone

image.altText: People march during a rally, some holding rifles.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump is on a revenge tour during his second stint in the White House and now his gaze has shifted to an enemy who once "humiliated" him — Nicolas Maduro.

title.children: Nicolas Maduro 'humiliated' Trump in his first term. Experts say Trump has not forgotten

image.altText: the torsos of two young children in school uniforms

props.synopsis: Unveiling its choice for word of the year, Dictionary.com explained that it was not quite sure what six-seven meant.

title.children: Gen Alpha's viral 'six-seven' named word of the year

image.altText: An older woman in a black tshirt standing with a younger woman in a white shirt

props.synopsis: Just three months in 2021, Frank Coleman was the ninth Indigenous death in custody in New South Wales.

title.children: Coroner backs overhaul to prevent more prisoners dying trying to get off drugs

image.altText: Rouse Hill scene pic ambos

props.synopsis: A girl has died after being struck by a car outside a school in Sydney's north-west on Thursday afternoon.

title.children: Girl, 5, dies after being hit by car outside Sydney school

image.altText: Ryan stands in front of his organic and sleek modern passive house that's all concrete, big windows, with surprising boulders.

props.synopsis: Five months after Ryan Moody moved into his passive house, we check in to see if the hard work was worth it — and what everyday Australians can take from passive house principles.

title.children: The pros, cons and misconceptions about passive houses

image.altText: People inside a building.

props.synopsis: A ratepayers' group is calling for an audit of a major heritage building's $20 million redevelopment for what it says are reported design flaws, rendering it "not fit for purpose".

title.children: Questions over $20m redevelopment to 1890s building in Launceston

image.altText: A split image showing two pictures, a young leader on the left, an older man with silver hair on the right.

props.synopsis: Geert Wilders' Freedom Party lost ground in elections which had been seen as a potential test of the far-right's staying power in European politics.

title.children: Dutch centrists 'confident' as far-right party suffers setback in election

image.altText: A man sitting in a doorway, photographed from behind.

props.synopsis: Parents are demanding answers from centre operators after their children were allegedly sexually abused by other children while in child care.

title.children: 'Everyone's seeing it': Inside the childcare sector a new problem is on the rise

image.altText: Two men either side of an Aboriginal woman who has a soft facial expression and is wearing a blue top and blazer.

props.synopsis: Court documents reveal the Northern Territory senator rejected a $60,000 settlement offer two months before making a public appeal for help to fund her defamation defence in the Federal Court.

title.children: Court documents reveal Nampijinpa Price rejected settlement offer

image.altText: A home in ruins as storm is overhead.

props.synopsis: Pictures of the aftermath of Hurricane Melissa, the "storm of the century" that tore through Jamaica, Cuba and Haiti, reveal a trail of damage and displacement.

title.children: Devastating scale of Hurricane Melissa revealed in images

image.altText: Three men sit with their heads bowed in chairs in front of three judges.

props.synopsis: A trial has begun in Bali for three Australian men accused of killing a Melbourne father in an alleged premeditated hit.

title.children: Police allege Australians were given delivery driver jackets before Bali shooting

image.altText: A man in a high-vis jacket at night, beside a police car.

props.synopsis: A Perth man who raped two teenagers more than 30 years ago but was only charged last year after a genetic genealogy breakthrough, is jailed for 13 and a half years.

title.children: Man jailed after DNA breakthrough leads to conviction for 1990s sex assaults

image.altText: Annika Nielsen poses in the dark in a fashionable lace dress.

props.synopsis: Curve model Annika Nielsen says representation is sometimes "something that you don't realise that you miss or that you need until you see it".

title.children: Is the Victoria's Secret catwalk a 'lone gesture'?

image.altText: A man with long white hair looks down at his phone while walking down the steps of a court building.

props.synopsis: A Perth businessman who defrauded clients of more than $34 million in what was described as a "Ponzi scheme" has been sentenced to 14 years in prison.

title.children: 'Shame is yours': Ponzi scheme fraudster gets 14 years for $34m deception

image.altText: A picture of a military-style boat

props.synopsis: Almost four weeks after a $25 million Australian-gifted patrol boat ran aground on a reef while ferrying government officials, the Vanuatu government has yet to reveal the circumstances around the grounding, saying "an investigation is continuing".

title.children: Questions over Australian-gifted patrol boat smashed on reef during 'VIP transport'

image.altText: A black-and-white CCTV image of a man carrying jerry cans on a footpath at night.

props.synopsis: Specialist detectives who handle racially motivated threats are investigating an incident at a mosque in Perth's south-east in which a mystery offender poured non-flammable motor oil across the main entrance.

title.children: Islamic leaders condemn 'reckless, targeted' incident at Perth mosque
